channel.title: Comments for page "Tiger Blood"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Tiger Blood"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Ups, I was wrong, Buretsu did :) (last letter tricked me as it is the same O_O)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: 0, as far I see u already added it :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: ahem. this item can supposedly be "consumed." appetite?

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Hmmm, really, didn't noticed this line xD Then 1-5 numbers won in biggest ticket is a faaaaail :D

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: If you press the "Show Payment Schedule" option on the pigeons page, you will see what counts as a winning ticket. the 0 spots out of 11 counts as a winning ticket, and you can get a tiger blood even if all you claim is a 0/11 ticket. After testing how much spots it counts for, I reached the conclusion that it counts as a single spot win. Sl the minimum won in an 11 spot ticket is 0/11 :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: I think that winning numbers are such (!) that gives more than 1(/11/111 in B/S/G tickets) ryo, i.e. 4 numbers win ticket and counted for bloods in tickets with 4, 5 and 6 bets, but NOT in others, so in 11 bets-tickets 2 minimum won (aka 6/11) get u 1 blood, 4 give 2 and so on :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Just wanted to share that after a bit of testing, I believe a 0 spots winning ticket counts as a single number win for tiger blood gain. So getting a 10/11 and a 0/11 can net you a blood.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: which makes mass (50) bronze tickets with 11 random numbers the most efficient/cheapest way of getting them.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: get 11 winning numbers… so two 6/11 wins (6/11 + 6/11) would get you one, but a 0/11 and a 6/11 win would not.

item.title: Clarity
item.content:encoded: Can someone please make it more clear how this item is obtained? "Get 11 winning numbers" is really vague - does it mean get a total of 11 spots across a certain number of tickets? Or does it mean get 11 tickets that win something (more than 1/11/111 ryo) ? Or do you actually have to get all 11 spots on one ticket? Or maybe something else entirely?
